text: or NASDA,NASDA is an acronym. NASDA stands for "National Space Development Agency". was one Japan's national space agencies from 1969 to 2003. NASDA was responsible for developing satellites and space exerpiments.Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), NASDA history ; retrieved 2012-8-10. ==History== NASDA was established for peaceful purposes in 1969. In 2003, NASDA merged with the Institute of Space and Astronautical Science (ISAS) and the National Aerospace Laboratory of Japan (NAL). The three groups became one Independent Administrative Institution called the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA).Kamiya, Setsuko, "Japan a low-key player in space race", Japan Times, June 30, 2009, p. 3; retrieved 2012-4-2. Several projects at International Space Station (ISS) were started under NASDA; and the work continues as part of JAXA's on-going research programs. ==References== == Other websites == * "Space Programs" at Society of Japanese Aerospace Companies (SJAC) Category:1969 establishments in Asia Category:Japanese space program Category:Space agencies Category:1960s establishments in Japan
title: National Space Development Agency
